definition: powerful individual, family or group/clique/(loanword) valve
the Zhili faction of the Northern Warlords

sentences.english: He also began to carry it out as soon as he took charge of FengXi warlord.
sentences.chinese: 在掌控奉系軍閥統治權後，他也開始踐行這一思想。

sentences.english: His followers did not carouse, like the troops of many warlord armies.
sentences.chinese: 他的部下也不象許多軍閥的軍隊那樣大喫大喝。

sentences.english: A struggle has been started against the tendency towards new warlordism in the Eighth Route Army .
sentences.chinese: 在八路軍中，開始向新軍閥主義傾向作鬥爭。

sentences.english: In 1927 he died on the gallows of the warlords.
sentences.chinese: 1927年他犧牲在軍閥的絞刑架上。

sentences.english: Once again, opportunistic Imperial warlords pounced .
sentences.chinese: 善於投機的帝國軍閥再度崛起。

sentences.english: Many have been struck by lightning and burned to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 許多建築被閃電擊中燒燬於地，另一些被軍閥燒燬。

sentences.english: Parts of the country are still dominated by warlords.
sentences.chinese: 該國仍部分由軍閥式首腦統治着。

sentences.english: The collapse of the Han dynasty was followed by nearly four centuries of rule by warlords.
sentences.chinese: 漢朝滅亡後是長達四個世紀的軍閥割據時代。

sentences.english: After the overthrow of the Qing dynasty, Shanxi was held by warlord Yan Xishan.
sentences.chinese: 清朝被推翻後，山西被軍閥閻錫山佔領。

sentences.english: Dayuan in Beijing was a private garden created by a warlord during 1919-1922.
sentences.chinese: 北京達園是民國初年軍閥王懷慶所築的私家花園。

sentences.english: Warlords from Szechuan stopped sending rice down the Yangtze.
sentences.chinese: 四川軍閥停止把大米運住長江下游。

sentences.english: China did indeed slide into disarray, warlordism and insurrection after 1911.
sentences.chinese: 1911年後的中國確實陷入了軍閥混戰的亂局。

sentences.english: The period of the Northern Warlords' rule over China was an era of a great change.
sentences.chinese: 北洋軍閥統治時期，是個大變局時代。

sentences.english: The administrative ability of the government had been weakened by the warlord blocs.
sentences.chinese: 軍閥集團嚴重削弱了政府的行政能力。

sentences.english: Beiyang government and Manjing government are corrupt.
sentences.chinese: 北洋軍閥政府及南京國民政府政治腐敗。

sentences.english: First, justice Japan' s Showa period, Tanaka was the first person to warlords in power.
sentences.chinese: 田中義一是日本昭和時期軍閥當政的第一人。

definition: Feng Yuxiang (1882-1948), warlord during Republic of China, strongly critical of Chiang Kai-shek
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
mutiny/(Tw) to be dumped by one's girlfriend while serving in the army
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
